<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Key Operating Metrics
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting increased 12.2% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, mainly due to the acquisition of McKinnis within our
	Healthcare segment in December 2015 and the acquisition of Ecofys within our Energy segment in November 2016, as well as additional hiring within our Healthcare, Financial Services Advisory and Compliance and Energy segments. Average
	FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process increased 6.2% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 mainly due to the acquisition of RevenueMed within our Healthcare segment in February
	2015, which added 1,500 Client-Service FTE (Average FTE reflects partial year of ownership). Period end FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 decreased 5.0% reflecting full impact of 1,500
	Client-Service FTE acquired from RevenueMed which was more than offset by actions taken in 2015 to realign resource with demand for these types of services. Average
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-billable
</FONT>
	FTE were up 19.2% for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 mainly due to new hires made to support the growth of the business. Utilization levels were 75% for each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, and average
	bill rate increased 1.0% to $291 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting was relatively flat for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, with decreases within the Disputes, Forensics&nbsp;&amp; Legal Technology segment offsetting increases within the Financial Services Advisory and Compliance and Energy segments. Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;Technology,
	Data&nbsp;&amp; Process increased 172.8% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 mainly due to our acquisition of RevenueMed discussed above. Average
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-billable
</FONT>
	FTE were up 21.0% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, mainly due to new hires made to support the growth of the business. Utilization
	levels were 75% for each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, and average bill rate increased 2.1% to $288 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Results for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Revenue before Reimbursements.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	See segment results below for further discussion on RBR.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Cost of Services before Reimbursable Expenses.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of services before reimbursable expenses increased 10.5%
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was primarily due to higher compensation and benefits expense mainly relating to personnel acquired in acquisitions and additional hiring of
	Client-Service FTE within our Healthcare, Financial Services Advisory and Compliance, and Energy segments, partially offset by Client-Service FTE decreases within our Disputes, Forensics&nbsp;&amp; Legal Technology
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	29
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	segment. In addition, training and meeting expenses, and recruiting and retention costs were higher for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
	Incentive-based compensation also increased due to improved operating performance. Severance expense relating to Client-Service FTE decreased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the corresponding period in 2015 at $4.2&nbsp;million
	and $5.9&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	General and Administrative Expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	General and
	administrative expenses increased 14.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was mainly due to additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-billable
</FONT>
	FTE hired to support
	growth of the business resulting in higher compensation and benefits expense. Average
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-billable
</FONT>
	FTE included in general and administrative expenses for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 were
	757 and 639, respectively. Incentive-based compensation also increased during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 due to improved operating performance. Training and meeting expenses were also higher for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, due
	in part to a firm-wide leadership meeting held during the second quarter of 2016, while no such meeting was held in the corresponding period of 2015. Facilities expenses increased related to rent expense for our new corporate headquarters in
	Chicago, for which we took possession of in October 2016 to build out the new office space. In addition, bad debt expense increased to $8.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to $2.6&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 as a result of higher days sales outstanding for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. These increases were partially offset by a decrease in cloud storage costs partly as a result of higher allocation to our Technology,
	Data&nbsp;&amp; Process businesses and legal expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	General and administrative expenses were 18.0% and 17.7% of RBR for the
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively. The increase was primarily due to the reasons discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Depreciation Expense
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The increase in depreciation expense of 17.5% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to increased technology infrastructure spending, software, and leasehold improvements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Amortization Expense
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization expense increased 33.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was
	primarily due to the allocation of purchase price to intangible assets of recent acquisitions, partially offset by reduced amortization relating to certain intangible assets as their useful lives came to term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Other Operating Costs (Benefit):
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Contingent Acquisition Liability Adjustment, Net.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 we recorded costs of $1.3&nbsp;million compared to benefits of
	$13.0&nbsp;million recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 relating to fair value adjustments to our estimated deferred contingent acquisition liabilities. The adjustments made during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily
	related to our Cymetrix acquisition. For additional information, see Note 16&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Fair Value to the notes to our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Office Consolidation, Net.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we recorded costs of $0.5&nbsp;million and $2.8&nbsp;million, respectively. The costs
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 related to the consolidation of office space acquired in Denver, Colorado following the McKinnis acquisition. The costs during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily related to our new
	consolidated office space in New York City and included duplicate rent expense as we occupied our old New York City offices until completion of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	build-out
</FONT>
	of the new office space in April 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Interest Expense
</I>
	.
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	Interest expense increased 6.5% or $0.3&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was mainly due to a higher average debt balance in 2016 due to the McKinnis acquisition which was offset by lower imputed interest relating to the deferred
	contingent consideration payable to the Cymetrix selling stockholders. Average borrowing rates were 2.3% and 2.2% for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Other Income, Net.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	The increase of 155.6% or $1.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016
	compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to the gains resulting from
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-functional
</FONT>
	currency transactions occurring in our U.K. based entity where the local currency (the U.K. Pound
	Sterling) weakened, partially offset by a 2015 legal settlement received.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Income Tax Expense.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our effective income tax rate fluctuates
	based on the mix of income earned in various tax jurisdictions, including U.S. state and foreign jurisdictions which have different income tax rates, as well as various
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	book-to-tax
</FONT>
</FONT>
	permanent differences. The rate is also impacted by discrete items which may not be consistent from year to year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The effective income tax rate for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 was 37.8% and 31.5% respectively. The increase in the
	effective income tax rate for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily relates to discrete items recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, including a nontaxable deferred
	contingent acquisition liability fair value adjustment, favorable state-enacted legislative changes and favorable income tax settlements recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 which reduced income tax expense by approximately
	$6.2&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Results for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Revenue before Reimbursements.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	See segment results below for further discussion on RBR.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Cost of Services before Reimbursable Expenses.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of services before reimbursable expenses
	increased 10.2% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was mainly due to acquisitions, increases in compensation and benefits expense and recruiting and retention costs mainly
	associated with the Client-Service FTE increase and incentive-based compensation relating to improved operating performance. In addition, severance expense relating to Client-Service FTE for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was
	$5.9&nbsp;million and $4.2&nbsp;million, respectively, as we took actions to better align our resources with demand for certain services and integrate our recent acquisitions. These increases were partially offset by certain margin improvement
	initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	General and Administrative Expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	General and administrative expenses increased
	8.4% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was mainly due to higher compensation and benefits expense as a result of an increase in Average
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-billable
</FONT>
	FTE, higher incentive-based compensation and incremental costs relating to our acquisition of RevenueMed (acquired in February 2015) and Cymetrix (acquired in May 2014). Average
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-billable
</FONT>
	FTE for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 were 639 and 527, respectively. In addition, technology expenses were higher due to license renewals and an increase in cloud storage costs partly
	as a result of less allocation to our Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process businesses, and facilities expense was also higher due to a 2014 operating expense abatement. These increases were offset by lower bad debt expenses which were
	$2.6&nbsp;million and $5.0&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and lower acquisition transaction costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	General and administrative expenses were 17.7% of RBR for each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Depreciation Expense
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The increase in depreciation expense of 20.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was primarily
	due to increased technology infrastructure spending, software, leasehold improvements and the impact of property and equipment acquired in recent acquisitions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Amortization Expense
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization expense increased 44.5% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was due
	to the allocation of purchase price to intangible assets of recent acquisitions offset by amortization relating to certain intangible assets as their useful lives came to term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Other Operating Costs (Benefit):
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Contingent Acquisition
	Liability Adjustment, Net.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recorded benefits of $13.0&nbsp;million relating to fair value adjustments to our estimated deferred contingent acquisition liabilities, primarily
	related to our Cymetrix acquisition. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recorded benefits of $5.0&nbsp;million relating to the fair value adjustments to our estimated deferred contingent acquisition liabilities (see Note
	16&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Fair Value to the notes to our consolidated financial statements).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	31
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Office Consolidation, Net.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recorded a cost of $2.8&nbsp;million related to our new consolidated office space located in New York City which we took possession of on October&nbsp;22, 2014. The cost includes future rent expense, net of expected
	sublease income, accelerated depreciation and deferred rent relating to the old space and rent expense for duplicate rent as we occupied our old New York City office space until completion of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	build-out
</FONT>
	of
	the new space in April 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Goodwill Impairment.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based upon the results of our
	annual goodwill impairment test, a pretax goodwill impairment of $122.0&nbsp;million was recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. No such impairment was identified during our 2015 annual goodwill impairment test.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Other Impairment
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recorded a
	$1.3&nbsp;million impairment on software that is no longer being utilized by our consultants for client engagements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Interest Expense
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense decreased 16.9% or $1.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was mainly due to lower imputed interest relating to the deferred contingent
	consideration payable to the Cymetrix selling stockholders and a slightly lower average borrowing rate partially offset by higher average borrowings. Average borrowing rates were 2.2% and 2.3% for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Income Tax Expense.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our effective income tax rate fluctuates based on the mix of
	income earned in various tax jurisdictions, including U.S. state and foreign jurisdictions, which have different income tax rates, as well as various
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	book-to-tax
</FONT>
</FONT>
	permanent differences. The rate is also impacted by discrete items which may not be consistent from year to year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	effective income tax rate for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was 31.5% and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-3.5%,
</FONT>
	respectively. These rates are not comparable to the prior-year period due to the impact of the goodwill
	impairment of $122.0&nbsp;million related to both tax deductible and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-tax
</FONT>
	deductible components of goodwill recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 that reduced income tax expense by
	approximately $35.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The effective income tax rate for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, excluding the
	goodwill impairment charge from continuing operations would have been 40.3%. The effective income tax rate for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was favorably impacted 6.9% or $6.2&nbsp;million by the nontaxable nature of a deferred contingent
	acquisition liability fair value adjustment, favorable state-enacted legislative changes and favorable income tax settlements recorded in the current year period as compared to discrete items in the prior-year period that primarily related to
	unfavorable state-enacted legislative changes and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-deductible
</FONT>
	acquisition related costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Income from Discontinued Operations, net of tax
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income from discontinued operations, net of tax was $0.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. During the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we sold the U.K. financial services advisory business within our Financial Services Advisory and Compliance segment. In connection with the sale, during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we received payment in
	full for a holdback receivable which we had partially reserved for possible working capital adjustments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Segment Results
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our operating segments are the same as our reporting segments. During the first quarter of 2016, we renamed two of our business segments.
	The Disputes, Forensics&nbsp;&amp; Legal Technology segment was formerly known as the Disputes, Investigations&nbsp;&amp; Economics segment, and the Financial Services Advisory and Compliance segment was formerly known as the Financial,
	Risk&nbsp;&amp; Compliance segment. Other than the changes to the names of these segments, the characteristics of our business segments remain unchanged. Our performance is assessed and resources are allocated based on the following four reporting
	segments:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following information includes segment RBR, segment total revenues and segment operating
	profit all on a continuing basis. Certain unallocated expense amounts related to specific reporting segments have been excluded from the calculation of segment operating profit to be consistent with the information used by management to evaluate
	segment performance (see Note 4&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Segment Information to the notes to our consolidated financial statements). Segment operating profit represents total revenues less cost of services excluding long-term compensation expense
	attributable to client-service employees. Long-term compensation expense attributable to client-service employees includes share-based compensation expense and compensation expense related to retention incentives (see Note
	9&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Supplemental Consolidated Balance Sheet Information to the notes to our consolidated financial statements). Key operating metric definitions are provided above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The information presented does not necessarily reflect the results of segment operations that would have occurred had the segments been
	stand-alone businesses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</FONT>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	6.2
</FONT>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</FONT>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	The Healthcare segment provides consulting services and business process management services. Clients
	of this segment include healthcare providers, payers and life sciences companies. We help clients respond to market legislative changes such as the shift to an outcomes and value-based reimbursements model, ongoing industry consolidation and
	reorganization, Medicaid expansion, and the implementation of a new electronic health records system.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended
	December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment
	increased 22.7% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. RBR for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 reflected the benefit of acquisitions made during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Over
	half of the year-over-year RBR increase was due to organic growth, driven by strong demand for large
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	strategy-led
</FONT>
	transformation projects and revenue cycle consulting engagements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting increased 32.5% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 mainly due to the 76 professionals added from the McKinnis acquisition and additional hiring to meet the higher client demand. Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process increased 7.8% for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 is primarily due to the fact that the year ended December 2015 reflected partial period employment of approximately 1,500 professionals acquired in February 2015 with the
	RevenueMed acquisition. Utilization increased 1.3% for the same period. Average bill rate decreased slightly to $271 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 mainly due to increased leverage of
	resources and a change in project mix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015, segment operating profit and segment operating profit margin increased $24.3&nbsp;million and 1.0 percentage point, respectively. These increases were attributable to the impact of higher RBR partially offset by higher compensation and
	benefits expense, incentive-based compensation and retention and training costs mainly related to acquired FTE as well as new hires.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	33
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended
	December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2014
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment increased 29.0% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. RBR for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 reflected the May 2014 acquisition of Cymetrix and February 2015 acquisition of RevenueMed. Nearly half of the year-over-year RBR increase was due to
	organic growth, primarily from increased client demand in all consulting areas and contributions from business process management services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting was flat for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and utilization increased 1.3% for the same period. Average
	FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process increased significantly for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 due to the above mentioned acquisitions as well as new hires relating to our
	physician revenue cycle management group. Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 reflected partial period employment of approximately 1,500 professionals. Average bill rate
	increased 6.2% to $274 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 due to bill rate increases and change in project mix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, segment operating profit and segment operating profit margin increased $25.8&nbsp;million and 2.4 percentage points, respectively. These increases were attributable
	to increased bill rates, higher utilization, performance-based fees and the implementation of other margin improvement initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	The Energy segment provides advisory services to utilities, governmental agencies, manufacturers and
	investors. We provide our clients with advisory solutions in business strategy and planning, distributed energy resources and renewables, energy efficiency and demand response, and grid modernization. In addition, we provide a broad array of
	benchmarking and research services.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended
	December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment increased 9.4% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016
	compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. RBR for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 reflected the November 2016 acquisition of Ecofys. Nearly
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	two-thirds
</FONT>
	of the year-over-year RBR increase was due
	to organic growth, primarily due to an increase in demand for strategy and operations and energy efficiency evaluation and standards engagements driven by ongoing penetration of key client accounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting increased 9.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily due to the Ecofys acquisition and additional hires to support increased demand for the segment&#146;s service offerings as noted above. Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process decreased 4.6%
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 mainly due to resource alignment. Utilization decreased 2.7% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	mainly due to delays in expected sales pipeline conversion. Average bill rate increased 3.0% to $205 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 due to bill rate increases and changes in project mix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	34
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	segment operating profit increased $1.3&nbsp;million mainly due to the Ecofys acquisition. Segment operating profit margin decreased 1.5 percentage points for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as
	the costs of new hires outpaced associated RBR growth for the year and certain engagements were accepted at lower margin levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2014
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment increased 8.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The
	year-over-year increase was mainly due to increased demand for the segment&#146;s strategy and operations service offerings led by risk management, transmission planning, and performance excellence. Utilization was flat for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting increased
	4.2% relating to hiring offset by attrition and the personnel reclassification mentioned below. Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process increased 25.0% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 mainly due to the reclassification of 10 FTE previously reported within FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting to FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process in 2015 in order to combine the segment&#146;s research,
	benchmarking and modeling teams. Average bill rate increased 4.2% to $199 over the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 due to bill rate increases and changes in project mix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, segment operating profit increased
	$0.9&nbsp;million due to higher RBR partially offset by higher compensation and benefits expenses and incentive based compensation. Segment operating profit margin decreased 1.6 percentage points for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as a result of certain investments in targeted growth areas for the segment which, in turn, resulted in higher compensation and recruiting expenses without an offsetting increase in RBR.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	The Financial Services Advisory and Compliance (formerly Financial, Risk&nbsp;&amp; Compliance) segment
	provides strategic, operational, valuation, risk management, investigative and compliance advisory services to clients primarily in the highly-regulated financial services industry, including major financial and insurance institutions. This segment
	also provides anti-corruption solutions and anti-money laundering consulting, litigation support and tax compliance and valuation services to clients in a broad variety of industries.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment increased 22.4% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The
	year-over-year increase in RBR was primarily due to increased demand for financial crimes consulting expertise and compliance engagements from major financial institutions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting increased 5.1% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 to meet demand needs. Average bill rate increased 9.5% to
	$301 for the year ended
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 mainly due to a change in project mix. Utilization increased 2.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 mainly due to the higher volume of work discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, segment operating profit and segment operating profit margin increased $14.3&nbsp;million and 2.2 percentage points, respectively, mainly due to higher RBR driven by higher
	demand, higher bill rates and utilization, and use of flexible resources, partially offset by higher compensation and benefits expense due to an increase in FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting, annual wage increases and higher incentive-based
	compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31,
	2014
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment decreased 8.2% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. The year-over-year decrease in RBR was mainly due to a lower volume of work from an ongoing large financial institution client.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting increased 7.3% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 primarily due to additional compliance consulting work
	and continuing demand for anti-money laundering consulting services which drove additional hiring and the conversion of certain project employees to FTE status during the second half of 2014. Average bill rate was flat at $275 for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Utilization decreased 5.0% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 mainly due to the lower volume of work discussed above
	in the 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014,
	segment operating profit and segment operating profit margin decreased $9.8&nbsp;million and 4.0 percentage points, respectively, primarily due to the decrease in RBR.&nbsp;Costs also decreased, with lower incentive based compensation partially
	offset by increased retention costs for senior revenue generators and higher wages and benefits relating to the increase in Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	The Disputes, Forensics&nbsp;&amp; Legal Technology (formerly Disputes, Investigations&nbsp;&amp;
	Economics) segment&#146;s professional services include accounting, regulatory, construction and computer forensic expertise, as well as valuation and economic analysis. In addition to these capabilities, our professionals use technological tools to
	perform eDiscovery services and to deliver custom technology and data analytic solutions. The clients of this segment principally include companies along with their
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-house
</FONT>
	counsel and law firms, as well as
	accounting firms, corporate boards and government agencies.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to
	the year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment increased 0.6% for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The year-over-year increase in RBR was mainly due to strong demand for our global
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	36
</FONT>
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	expertise in complex industrial, infrastructure and commercial project matters and an increase in performance-based fees associated with mass tort claims work offset by a decline in demand due to
	the ongoing competitive environment for legal technology solutions. In addition, the segment experienced declines as a result of large engagements that ended during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. Although performance-based fees associated
	with mass tort claim work contributed to year-over-year growth, we do not expect to sustain the same level of performance-based fees going forward as during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting was relatively flat for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 as personnel reductions taken during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were offset by new hires within certain strategic growth areas during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;Technology,
	Data&nbsp;&amp; Process decreased 8.6% over the same periods due to the reasons discussed above. Average bill rate was relatively flat at $371 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Utilization
	decreased 2.7% for the same periods due to a shift in project mix driven by the change in demand discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 segment operating profit and segment operating profit margin increased $6.2&nbsp;million and 1.8 percentage points, respectively, mainly due to higher performance-based
	fees associated with mass tort claims work for which certain costs of services were incurred in prior periods and lower compensation and benefits expenses as a result of cost management actions taken during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, severance expense was $1.7&nbsp;million and $4.4&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	Year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	&nbsp;31, 2014
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	RBR for this segment increased 1.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The
	year-over-year increase in RBR was mainly due to increased demand for our global expertise in large infrastructure and construction matters and other large client engagements, partially offset by a decline due to the ongoing competitive environment
	for legal technology solutions. In addition, performance-based fees for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 were nil and $1.9&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Consulting decreased 6.2% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 due to planned personnel actions. Average
	FTE&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Technology, Data&nbsp;&amp; Process increased 5.5% due to an anticipated increase in demand for those services. Average bill rate increased 1.4% to $373 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. Utilization increased 5.6% in line with the segment&#146;s increase in RBR.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 segment operating profit decreased $2.0&nbsp;million mainly due to increased RBR partially offset by increased costs discussed below. Segment operating profit margin decreased
	1.1 percentage points mainly due to higher incentive based compensation and severance expense partially offset by higher RBR for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. For the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, severance expense was $4.4&nbsp;million and $1.5&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Unaudited Quarterly Results
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table sets forth certain unaudited quarterly financial information. The unaudited quarterly financial
	information was prepared on the same basis as the audited consolidated financial statements contained elsewhere in this report. The data includes all normal recurring adjustments necessary for the fair presentation of the information for the periods
	presented, when read in conjunction with our consolidated financial statements and related notes thereto. Results for any quarter are not necessarily indicative of results for the full year or for any future quarter.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating results fluctuate from quarter to quarter as a result of a number of factors, including the
	significance of client engagements commenced and completed during a quarter, timing of acquisitions, the number of business days in a quarter, employee hiring and utilization rates. The timing of revenues varies from quarter to quarter due to
	various factors, including the ability of clients to terminate engagements without penalty, attaining certain contractual outcomes, the size and scope of assignments, and general economic conditions. Because a significant percentage of our expenses
	are relatively fixed, a variation in the number of client assignments, or the timing of the initiation or the completion of client assignments, can cause significant variations in operating results from quarter to quarter. Operating results are also
	impacted by other operating costs (benefit). In addition, interest expense and interest income fluctuate from quarter to quarter as a result of balance changes in cash and debt. Other (income) loss will fluctuate from quarter to quarter due to the
	impact of foreign currency translations for transactions recorded in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-functional
</FONT>
	currencies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	38
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Generally, our primary sources of cash include cash flows from operations and borrowings under our credit
	facility. First quarter operating cash requirements are generally higher due to payment of our annual incentive bonuses while subsequent quarters&#146; operating cash requirements are generally lower. Our cash equivalents are primarily limited to
	money market accounts or &#145;A&#146; rated securities, with maturity dates of 90&nbsp;days or less.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We calculate accounts
	receivable Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) by dividing the accounts receivable balance, net of reserves and deferred revenue credits, at the end of the quarter, by daily revenues. Daily revenues are calculated by taking quarterly revenue divided by
	90&nbsp;days, approximately equal to the number of days in a quarter. DSO was 81 days at December&nbsp;31, 2016, compared to 76&nbsp;days at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 69 days at December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in DSO at December&nbsp;31, 2016
	compared to December&nbsp;31, 2015, reflects slower collections for select client engagements and milestone billing arrangements. DSO at December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased compared to December&nbsp;31, 2014 primarily due to the impact of the McKinnis
	acquisition and certain milestone billing arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash provided by operating activities was $110.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to $83.1&nbsp;million
	and $90.1&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively. The increase in cash provided by operating activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to overall company growth and
	other changes in operating assets and liabilities including lower
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	sign-on
</FONT>
	bonuses granted and higher incentive-based compensation accruals during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, partially offset by
	higher accounts receivable balances for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. As noted above, DSO at December&nbsp;31, 2016 was higher than at December&nbsp;31, 2015. The decrease in cash provided by operating activities for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was primarily due to increased working capital and income taxes paid.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Investing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used in investing activities was
	$51.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to $117.4&nbsp;million and $116.2&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, primarily due to lower cash used in investing activities in the
	current year for acquisitions (see Note 3&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Acquisitions to the notes to our consolidated financial statements) and capital expenditures. Cash used in investing activities was marginally higher in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 due to an increase in capital expenditures mainly relating to leasehold improvements associated with the consolidation of our offices located in New York City, technology infrastructure spending and
	higher deferred acquisition liability payments, partially offset by lower acquisitions spending during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 (see Note 3&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Acquisitions to the notes to our consolidated financial statements).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Financing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used in financing activities was $58.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 compared to net cash provided by financing activities of $40.8&nbsp;million and $26.9&nbsp;million
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The cash used in financing activities during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily related to higher repayments of bank borrowings made during 2016 and lower contingent
	acquisition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	39
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	liability payments compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The cash provided by financing activities increased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 primarily due to higher borrowings related to the McKinnis acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, we purchased 1,436,147 shares of our common stock in the open market for $25.1&nbsp;million compared to 1,589,072 shares for $24.0&nbsp;million and 1,653,315 shares for $27.3&nbsp;million during the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Debt, Commitments and Capital
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For further information regarding our debt, see Note 12&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Bank Debt to the notes to our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had total contractual obligations of $299.5&nbsp;million. The following table shows the
	components of our significant commitments at December&nbsp;31, 2016 by the scheduled years of payments (in thousands):
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:13%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Settlement of the liabilities is contingent upon certain acquisitions meeting performance targets. Assuming each of these acquisitions reaches their maximum target, our
	maximum deferred contingent acquisition liability would have been $27.8&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We have purchase obligations of $2.5&nbsp;million related to the purchase of furniture for our new corporate headquarters in Chicago and $0.4&nbsp;million related to IT
	services.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest incurred on amounts we borrow under the credit facility varies based on relative borrowing levels, fluctuations in the variable interest rates and the spread
	we pay over those interest rates. As such, we are unable to quantify our future obligations relating to interest on the credit facility. See Note 12 &#151; Bank Debt to the notes to our consolidated financial statements for further information on
	our credit facility.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	d)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had $4.1&nbsp;million of unused letters of credit under our credit facility, which have been included as a reduction in the available
	borrowings. The letters of credit are primarily related to the requirements of certain lease agreements for office space.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Through December&nbsp;31, 2016, we repurchased an aggregate of 8,573,960 shares of our common stock for approximately $126.1&nbsp;million under our share repurchase program. Effective July&nbsp;1, 2015,
	the share repurchase authorization was increased to $100.0&nbsp;million for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	30-month
</FONT>
	period ending December&nbsp;31, 2017. At December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had approximately $63.0&nbsp;million remaining for
	share repurchases under the board authorization. See Part II, Item 5 of this report for additional information on the share repurchases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, we retired 8,000,000 shares of treasury stock. As a result, within the stockholders&#146; equity accounts on our consolidated balance sheets, treasury stock
	was reduced by the fair value of the shares calculated using the weighted average treasury stock inventory price, common stock was reduced for the aggregate par value of the shares retired, with the difference recorded as a reduction to retained
	earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We believe that our current cash and cash equivalents, future cash flows from operations and borrowings under our
	credit facility will provide adequate liquidity to fund anticipated short-term and long-term operating activities. However, in the event we make significant cash expenditures in the future for major acquisitions or other unanticipated activities, we
	may require more liquidity than is currently available to us under our credit
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	40
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	facility and may need to raise additional funds through debt or equity financing, as appropriate. In addition, if our lenders are not able to fund their commitments due to disruptions in the
	financial markets or otherwise, our liquidity could be negatively impacted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Off-balance
</FONT>
	Sheet
	Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We do not maintain any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	off-balance
</FONT>
	sheet arrangements, transactions,
	obligations or other relationships with unconsolidated entities that would be expected to have a material current or future impact on our financial condition or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Critical Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The preparation of the financial statements
	requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect amounts reported therein. We base our estimates on historical experience and on various assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which
	form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources. Actual results may differ from these estimates under different assumptions or conditions. We believe the
	following critical accounting policies affect our more significant judgments and estimates used in the preparation of our consolidated financial statements:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Revenue Recognition
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We recognize revenues when evidence of an
	arrangement exists, the price of work is fixed or determinable, work is performed and collectability is reasonably assured. We generate the majority of our revenues from providing services under the following types of arrangements: time and
	material,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fixed-fee,
</FONT>
	units of production and performance based.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For our time and
	material arrangements, revenue is recognized based on the number of hours worked by our Client-Service FTE at the contracted bill rates. In some cases, our time and materials engagements are subject to a maximum fee amount not to be exceeded, in
	which case we periodically evaluate the progress of work performed to ensure that the maximum amount billable to the client is not expected to be exceeded. Additionally, revenue is recognized on our units of production arrangements in a similar
	manner based on measures such as the number of items processed at agreed-upon rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	With our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fixed-fee
</FONT>
	arrangements, we are contracted to complete a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-determined
</FONT>
	set of professional services for a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-determined
</FONT>
	fee.
	However, the fee and engagement scope can be adjusted based on a mutual agreement between us and the client. In many cases, the recording of fixed revenue amounts requires us to make an estimate of the total amount of work to be performed, and
	revenues are then recognized as efforts are expended based on hours worked unless another method such as output or straight-line is more representative of revenue earned.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We also have certain arrangements in which the fees are dependent on the completion of contractually defined outcomes. In many cases, this fee is earned in addition to an hourly or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fixed-fee,
</FONT>
	but is not recognized until certain contractual milestones or outcomes are met. Variations in our quarterly or yearly revenues and resulting operating profit margins may occur depending on the timing of
	such contractual outcomes and our ability to consider these revenues earned and realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We may provide multiple deliverables
	under the terms of one or multiple arrangements. Arrangements under these scenarios are evaluated in order to determine whether one or more units of accounting are present and revenue is allocated appropriately to each unit of accounting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Reimbursable expenses for our engagements include travel,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	out-of-pocket
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and independent contractor costs. Such expenses are passed through to clients as contractually allowed. Typically, reimbursable expenses are recognized as
	revenue during the period in which the expenses are incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	41
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D320810D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Revenues recognized for services performed but not yet billed are recorded as engagements in
	process within accounts receivable. Advance payments and retainers are recorded as deferred revenue within other current liabilities and are recognized as services are provided. Any taxes assessed on revenues relating to services provided to our
	clients are recorded on a net basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Accounts Receivable Realization
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We maintain allowances for doubtful accounts for estimated losses resulting from our clients&#146; inability to make required cash
	payments of amounts due to us or for disputes that affect our ability to fully collect our billed accounts receivable or for potential fee reductions negotiated by clients. Our estimation is based on historical collection and our review and
	assessment of our clients&#146; likelihood to make required cash payments of amounts due to us. Estimated losses may vary from actual results. If our clients&#146; financial condition were to deteriorate, resulting in an impairment of their ability
	to make payments, additional allowances might be required. If the collectability of billed amounts is not assured, an allowance is recorded to general and administrative expense. If the collectability of unbilled amounts is not assured or certain
	pricing adjustments are made, an allowance is recorded as a reduction to revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Business Combinations
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We recognize and measure identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed and any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-controlling
</FONT>
	interest in the acquiree as of the acquisition date at fair value. Fair value measurements require extensive use of estimates and assumptions, including estimates of future cash flows to be
	generated by the acquired assets. In addition, we recognize and measure contingent consideration at fair value as of the acquisition date. Contingent consideration obligations that are classified as liabilities are remeasured at fair value each
	reporting period with the changes in fair value resulting from either the passage of time, revised expectations of performance, or ultimate settlement to the amount or timing of the initial measurement recognized in the consolidated statements of
	comprehensive income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Goodwill and Intangible Assets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Goodwill represents the difference between the purchase price of the acquired business and the related fair value of the net assets
	acquired, which is accounted for by the acquisition method of accounting. Intangible assets consist of identifiable intangibles other than goodwill. Identifiable intangible assets other than goodwill include customer lists and relationships,
	employee
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-compete
</FONT>
	agreements, backlog revenue and trade names. These assets are subject to changes in events or circumstances that could impact their carrying value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Goodwill is tested for impairment annually during the second quarter. In addition to our annual goodwill test, on a periodic basis, we are
	required to consider whether it is more likely than not that the fair value has fallen below the carrying amount of an asset, thus requiring us to perform an interim goodwill impairment test. We consider elements and other factors including, but not
	limited to:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	adverse changes in the business climate in which we operate;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	attrition of key personnel;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
